bill_title: establish certain record keeping requirements related to the selling of livestock that originated in the livestock inspection area and to establish a penalty.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to establish certain record keeping requirements related to the selling of livestock that originated in the livestock inspection area and to establish a penalty. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 40-20 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Any livestock agency located outside of the ownership inspection area that sells livestock which originate in the ownership inspection area shall keep a copy of the local inspection certificate, market clearance, or other board authorization that authorized the livestock to leave the ownership inspection area. The records shall clearly show the name and address of the person or firm for whom the animals were sold and the descriptions of the animals. The records may be examined by law enforcement officers or agents of the board upon request. This section does not apply to open markets. A violation of this section is a petty offense. Each violation is a separate offense. 300 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.029 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
